full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 765 Filed 08/10/22 Page 15 of 95 2753
LCI1MAX1
1 asked for before, last sentence, "Count Four relates solely to Jane and the time period --"
2
3 THE COURT: Okay. I'll accept that.
4
5 Page 15, line 20, the sentence that begins, "Count Four," adding "solely" after "relates," so the sentence would read, "Count Four relates solely to Jane."
6
7 Okay. Next?
8
9 MR. EVERDELL: Page 16, line 2, similar request: "Count Six relates solely to Carolyn."
10
11 THE COURT: Okay. I'll accept that.
12
13 Page 16, last line, adding "solely" after "relates" and before "to Carolyn."
14
15 Okay. Next page.
16
17 MR. EVERDELL: Page 17, this is a small one, your Honor.
18
19 THE COURT: Okay.
20
21 MR. EVERDELL: Lines 2 to 3, "Each count charges the defendant," since we're using "Ms. Maxwell" in the other parts of this charge, we'll just say, "Each count charges Ms. Maxwell with a different crime."
22
23 THE COURT: All right. That's fine.
24
25 So instruction 11, page 17, line 3, changing "defendant" to "Ms. Maxwell." So the sentence reads, "Each count charges Ms. Maxwell with a different crime."
26
27 MR. EVERDELL: Your Honor, can I just have one moment.
28
29 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00014319
